quotes.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.text: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can’t accept not trying.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.text: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
quotes.author: Vidal Sassoon

quotes.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
quotes.author: Sam Levenson

quotes.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: The best revenge is massive success.
quotes.author: Frank Sinatra

quotes.text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
quotes.author: Tony Robbins

quotes.text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Life is short, and it's up to you to make it sweet.
quotes.author: Sarah Louise Delany

quotes.text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.text: You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: The big lesson in life, baby, is never be scared of anyone or anything.
quotes.author: Frank Sinatra

quotes.text: Curiosity about life in all of its aspects, I think, is still the secret of great creative people.
quotes.author: Leo Burnett

quotes.text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.text: Change the world by being yourself.
quotes.author: Amy Poehler

quotes.text: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot

quotes.text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: There are no mistakes, only opportunities.
quotes.author: Tina Fey

quotes.text: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.text: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Dream big and dare to fail.
quotes.author: Norman Vaughan

quotes.text: Keep your eyes on the stars and your feet on the ground.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: Life is ten percent what happens to us and ninety percent how we respond to it.
quotes.author: Charles R. Swindoll

quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.author: Confucius
